intro: Anthemis reuteriana, commonly known as the golden marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a white or pale center. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
